title: Jade Chen
text:
👋 Hi, I’m Jade!
👩🏻‍🍳 My journey began in an unexpected place—the kitchen. As a pastry chef, I thrived in fine dining, wholesale, and catering environments, where precision and efficiency were essential. While I loved the craft, I realized that the industry’s lifestyle wasn’t the right long-term fit for me.
🧠 This led me to explore my interest in human behavior, pursuing a B.A. in Psychology. I developed a strong foundation in behavioral neuroscience, gravitating toward analytically focused coursework. Through my studies, I became increasingly curious about how data could be used to better understand complex social issues.
👩🏻‍💻 That curiosity led me to pursue a B.Sc. minor in Data Science, where I gained expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data visualization. I worked on projects analyzing mental health trends and educational outcomes, blending my passion for psychology with data-driven insights.
💼 Now, as I approach graduation in May 2025, I’m looking for opportunities as a data analyst in organizations that use data for social good. My goal is to transform complex data into actionable insights that drive positive change in mental health and beyond.

Through my studies, I became increasingly curious about how data could be used to better understand complex social issues.
👩🏻‍💻 That curiosity led me to pursue a B.Sc. minor in Data Science, where I gained expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data visualization. I worked on projects analyzing mental health trends and educational outcomes, blending my passion for psychology with data-driven insights.

title: Jade Chen
text:
Education
University of British Columbia B.A. Major in Psychology B.Sc. Minor in Data Science

title: Jade Chen
text:
Outside of Data
🧗 Climbing I’m the community outreach executive and routesetter at UBC’s Aviary Climbing Gym, where I set sport climbing problems and organize community events.
📖 Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) I co-founded Human Bean Books, where I lead secondary research for children’s books that promote emotional well-being and literacy.
🍪 Pastry I still love creating pastries and experimenting with new recipes in my free time. Currently, I am developing a recipe book to share with friends and family.

title: Jade Chen
text:
Link: GitHub
Duration: Sept 2023 – Dec 2023
Tools Used: R, Lasso Regularization, Predictive Modeling
In this project, I used Lasso regularization to predict student performance in mathematics. By applying predictive modeling techniques in R, I was able to improve the model’s accuracy by 7%. The project involved extensive data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.

title: Jade Chen
section: Wellbeing During COVID-19 in the UK
text:
Wellbeing During COVID-19 in the UK
Link: TODO
Duration: Sept 2023 – Dec 2023
Tools Used: Python, Data Visualization, Pandas, Matplotlib
This project involved analyzing mental health trends during the COVID-19 pandemic in the UK. I created interactive visualizations to showcase the impact of the pandemic on wellbeing, using Pandas for data manipulation and Matplotlib for plotting. The goal was to identify patterns in the data and provide actionable insights.

title: Jade Chen
text: I’m a data analyst with a background in data science and psychology. I specialize in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data visualization using Python, R, and SQL.
